description: The trips were revealed by a subpoena of Harlan Crow, the conservative mega donor.
title: Justice Thomas took more trips paid for my GOP donor than he disclosed, senator says

description: The rollout of online passport renewal is restricted to certain windows, beginning midday Eastern time weekly. Officials say the processing times for renewing online are the same as renewing by mail.
title: You can get your passport renewed online again. Here's how it works

description:
Authorities in Venezuela are using all manner of tricks to try to ensure President Nicholas Maduro is reelected next month. However, as we hear, it seems that the stunts and intimidation are not working.

And in China, the number of American's studying abroad is increasing, but is nowhere near pre-COVID levels. We look at why.
title: Election Tricks in Venezuela; American Students Slowly Return to China

description: The Supreme Court’s unanimous ruling upholds access to mifepristone, a drug used in more than 60% of abortions. The decision shocked some doctors and abortion rights advocates.
title: Abortion providers back to ‘business as usual’ after high court's mifepristone ruling

description: The Makah tribe in Washington state will be able to resume their longstanding tradition of whaling, after NOAA Fisheries decided Thursday to give them a waiver for a hunt.
title: Indigenous Makah tribe in Washington allowed to resume whaling tradition

description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Kristen Waggoner, CEO and general counsel of the Alliance Defending Freedom, about Supreme Court preserved access to Mifepristone.
title: SCOTUS upholds Mifepristone access. What's next for the anti-abortion movement?

description: South Florida is being pummeled by heavy rain that's caused flooding in communities from Miami and Ft. Lauderdale. The rain, expected to continue through Friday, temporarily forced the closure of Interstate 95.
title: Heavy rains in South Florida cause major flooding

description: For the first time, the United States is hosting the Cricket T20 World Cup. And the U.S. squad is doing well with a critical match set for Friday against Ireland. The success has buoyed interest in the U.S.
title: The U.S. is hosting the Cricket World Cup, spurring increased interest in the sport

description: Akira Endo, the Japanese scientist whose research led to statin drugs, has died. Tens of millions of people in the U.S. take statins to reduce their cholesterol.
title: The scientist whose research led to cholesterol-lowering statin drugs, has died.

description: Biden faces waning support with voters under age 30, but his performance with older Americans is stronger. The generational split comes amid increased criticism for his response to the war in Gaza.
title: Will the generational divide on support for Israel impact the presidential election?

description: In Rome, a group of thieves managed to steal nearly $540,000 in jewelry from the Bulgari store before escaping through the sewers.
title: Burglars steal $500k in jewels from Bulgari, then escaped through Rome's sewers

description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with Michael Bommer, a man dying of colon cancer who created an AI avatar of himself for his wife, Anett, to interact with after he dies.
title: Memorializing loved ones through AI

description: A Boeing 737 Max 8 jet experienced a rare problem known as a Dutch roll before landing safely. The cause of the incident during a Southwest Airlines flight last month is under investigation.
title: The FAA is investigating a new incident involving a Boeing 737 Max 8 jet in midair

description: Rivals Joey Chestnut and Takeru Kobayashi will reunite in September for their first hot dog-eating competition in 15 years. Here's why the competitors and their fans are so hungry for a rematch.
title: The biggest rivals in hot dog-eating are headed for a rematch 15 years in the making

description: It's pretty amazing: bones from thousands of years ago yielded traces of malaria parasites. Disease historians are surprised by what they've learned.
title: A surprising history of malaria is revealed by clues from ancient bones

description: Canon-making is a core part of rap fandom, the subject of endless barbershop parleys and message-board battles. But something curdles when the companies that control the music business enter the chat.
title: GOAT debates are a hip-hop tradition. Spotify is here to spoil the fun

description: The decision was a loss for part-time Democratic activist Steve Elster, who contended that the living-person exception to the trademark law violated his right of free speech.
title: Supreme Court says marketer is not entitled to a trademark for 'Trump too small' T-shirts

description: Journalist Alexia Fernández Campbell says following the Civil War, some freed men and women were given titles to land -- but after President Lincoln's death, the land was taken back.
title: Reconstruction-era records reveal how formerly enslaved people were stripped of land

description: The court said that the challengers, a group called the Alliance for Hippocratic Medicine, had no right to be in court at all since neither the organization nor its members could show they had suffered any concrete injury.
title: Supreme Court rejects challenge to FDA's approval of mifepristone

description: Mediators try to bridge gaps after Hamas’ demands to Biden’s cease-fire plan. America’s eating champion Joey Chestnut is banned from a NYC hotdog contest after signing with a plant-based meat company.
title: Hamas’ cease-fire demands, Joey Chestnut banned from hot dog contest

description: The jury awarded plaintiffs $38.3 million in damages saying that Chiquita was liable for killings perpetrated by the AUC–Autodefensas Unidas de Colombia (the United Self-Defense Forces of Colombia).
title: A jury says Chiquita should pay millions over paramilitary killings in Colombia

description: The loss to India means the U.S. has a critical match coming up on Friday against Ireland. It's the first time the tournament has been held in the U.S.
title: India defeats the U.S. in a match in the Cricket T20 World Cup

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to businessman and talk radio show host John Catsimatidis, CEO of Red Apple Group, about support for presumptive GOP presidential nominee Donald Trump among business leaders.
title: A business leader, who's a vocal supporter of Trump, explains what corporations want

description: Psychedelics researchers and investors are still reeling from last week’s no vote for MDMA by a panel of advisers to the FDA.
title: Trouble for ecstasy? What MDMA’s FDA setback could mean for psychedelics

description:
David Lynch doesn't do a lot of interviews. The Twin Peaks and Mulholland Drive creator usually just lets his work speak for itself. But he was excited to talk to Rachel about his new album coming out this summer, Cellophane Memories. And he also was game to dive into his love for transcendental meditation, a fateful childhood psychosomatic illness and a memorable encounter with a Buddha statue.

To listen sponsor-free, access bonus episodes and support the show, sign up for Wild Card+ at plus.npr.org/wildcard
title: David Lynch says he thought his newest work was 'total BS' at first

description: Former President Donald Trump is set to meet with congressional Republicans to discuss policy plans for a possible second administration.
title: Trump to meet with GOP lawmakers to sketch a plan for a possible second term

description: A Whistleblower told ProPublica that Microsoft chose profit over security and left the U.S. government vulnerable to a Russian hack.
title: Whistleblower tells ProPublica about Microsoft's cybersecurity lapses

description: When the house where the iconic '80s baseball movie "Bull Durham" was filmed went on the market, it attracted a lot more fans than buyers.
title: Fans turned out when the 'Bull Durham' house went on the market for $1.6 million

description: G7 leaders are meeting in Puglia, Italy, this week. At the top of their agenda: the tricky details of how to use frozen Russian assets to support Ukraine.
title: Can seized Russian assets help pay for Ukraine aid?

description: Pixar's Inside Out was praised for helping kids understand how emotions affect their actions. Adults learned a few things too. The sequel's new characters include Anxiety, Embarrassment and Ennui.
title: The 'Inside Out' movies give kids an 'emotional vocabulary.' Therapists love that

description: Fighting in the Russia-Ukraine war has tended to pick up in summer, when it's warmer, drier and easier for both sides to maneuver. Here are five key regions and themes to know in the months ahead.
title: The war in Ukraine will likely intensify this summer. Here's what to know

description: A flexible film bristling with tiny sensors could make surgery safer for patients with a brain tumor or severe epilepsy.
title: This new brain-mapping device could make neurosurgery safer

description: On college campuses, women are making inroads in male-dominated fields like engineering and business. But that is not eliminating the earnings gaps in leadership and income in the workplace.
title: While women outnumber men on campus, their later earnings remain stuck

description: Researchers are studying why there's a dearth of black sperm donors and how to increase the numbers.
title: The lack of Black sperm donors is a nationwide problem

description: Utah' experiment in bringing court hearings to remote Indigenous communities instead of requiring people on probation and parole to travel long distances is inspiring other states.
title: Utah, hoping for ‘tangible results’ on recidivism, is looking for possible solutions

description: Jerry West is the player whose silhouette is depicted in the NBA's logo -- although the league has never officially confirmed that.
title: Lakers legend and hall of famer Jerry West dies at 86

description: It's the first day of the G7 summit in Italy -- President Biden is there. Israel and Hamas are willing to reach an initial ceasefire, but beyond that details get tricky.
title: Morning news brief

description: American students are slowly returning to China. Although concerns about their safety linger, some say it is still worth it, given the importance of China to the U.S.
title: Why the number of American students choosing to study in China remains low

description: Known as Przewalski’s horses, the animals have been missing from Kazakhstan’s landscape for 200 years. They're being reintroduced, where they'll play a crucial role in the ecosystem.
title: Wild horses are being reintroduced to their native habitat in Kazakhstan

description: Venezuela's authoritarian government has been making life complicated for the opposition's campaign efforts ahead of next month's presidential elections.
title: Venezuela’s regime aims to demoralize the opposition ahead of July's election

description: The downpours and flooding blocked roads, floated vehicles and delayed the Florida Panthers on their way to Stanley Cup games in Canada against the Edmonton Oilers.
title: After a rare flash flood emergency, Florida prepares for more heavy rainfall

description: Perfume sales have been soaring since the start of the pandemic. We'll look at what's luring younger consumers into the world of fragrance.
title: What’s drawing Gen Z into the world of perfume?

description: With the U.S., Great Britain and France facing elections in coming months and a rightward shift in European parliamentary elections, there is pressure for leaders to act while the status quo lasts.
title: G7 summit opens with deal to use Russian assets for Ukraine

description: A NASA simulation accidentally aired on the space agency's livestream. NASA said all crew members are healthy, safe and preparing for a spacewalk scheduled for Thursday.
title: NASA says it accidentally sent out an emergency signal meant for training purposes
